data.title: Trivia: Colourful station names
data.meta_description:
Not sure if this Trivia has been covered so please feel free to post any links if its already been covered.

But examples of colourful stations are Wylde...
data.text:
Not sure if this Trivia has been covered so please feel free to post any links if its already been covered.

But examples of colourful stations are Wylde Green and Whitehaven. Wonder if theres more??

Blackrod, and of course anything ending in Green, begining with Aycocks Green and ending in Wyldes Green, I think there are around 25.

White Hart Lane

Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch contains two colours.

For those of us who don't speak Welsh, could you highlight them?

Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch contains two colours.

White and red, respectively.

As in "St Mary's Church in the Hollow of the White Hazel near a Rapid Whirlpool and the Church of St. Tysilio near the Red Cave".

P.S. Is this station officially known by its long name?

Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch contains two colours.

In English (supposedly): St Maryâ€™s Church in the Hollow of the White Hazel Near to the Rapid Whirlpool of Llantysilio of the Red Cave.

But of course the official station name is only Llanfairpwll.

For those of us who don't speak Welsh, could you highlight them?

White and red, respectively.

As in "St Mary's Church in the Hollow of the White Hazel near a Rapid Whirlpool and the Church of St. Tysilio near the Red Cave".

Well, if we're allowing non-English words, I'll bid:

Rotherham and

Roterhithe

... 'rot' being German for 'red'.

Well, if we're allowing non-English words, I'll bid:

Rotherham and

Roterhithe

... 'rot' being German for 'red'.

I suppose Rugeley may be pushing this a bit too far!
